intro: Cremanthodium dissectum, commonly known as the dissected globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, woolly foliage and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, open habitats. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Cremanthodium dissectum is often found in alpine or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
